oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-16 - Part 2 (alternate/incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Alternate version of part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 16, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalist Little Texas Daisy, and Roy Acuff. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. The end of this disc contains some overlap with TR000639 - both are labeled as part 2, though this disc begins earlier in the broadcast and does not run to the end.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Golden West Cowboys; Little Texas Daisy; Roy Acuff; George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified fiddle tune] -- George D. Hay introduces the Golden West Cowboys with Little Texas Daisy -- Darling How Can You Forget So Soon (Little Texas Daisy, Golden West Cowboys) -- George D. Hay introduces the entire cast -- Turkey In The Straw (Opry cast) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- The Great Speckled Bird (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers -- Don't Let Your Deal Go Down (George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Little Texas Daisy; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Acuff, Roy; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group)
